description:
Tree works subject to Tree Preservation Officer Canonbury No. 5, 1975.
* Numbers in brackets relate to survey numbers used for application.

Lime (1) T26:  Crown lift to gutter height, reduce back from building by 3m., crown thin by 25%.

Lime (2) T27:  Crown lift to gutter height, reduce back from building by 3m., crown thin by 25%.

Robinia (3) T28:  Remove deadwood.

Robinia (4) T30:  Remove deadwood.

Lime (5) T31:  Reduce back from building to clear by 3m.  Crown thin by 25%.  Crown lift to gutter height, ONLY LATERAL BRANCHES OF DIAMETER LESS THAN 100mm. MAY BE REMOVED AT SOURCE.

Sycamore (7) T33:  Crown lift to 5m., reduce back from building to clear by 3m.

Cherry (9) T49:  Lift crown to 3m., ONLY LATERAL BRANCHES OF DIAMETER LESS THAN 100mm. MAY BE REMOVED AT SOURCE.

Sycamore (8) T34:  Reduce back from building to give 3m. clearance.

Lime (10) T48:  Reduce back from building to clear by 3m.  Crown thin by 25%.  Crown lift to gutter height; ONLY LATERAL BRANCHES OF DIAMETER LESS THAN 100mm. MAY BE REMOVED AT SOURCE.

Maple (13) T45:  Reduce back from building to clear by 3m., crown thin by 25%, crown lift to gutter height; ONLY LATERAL BRANCHES OF DIAMETER LESS THAN 150mm. MAY BE REMOVED AT SOURCE.

Ailanthus (14) T44:  Remove two lowermost branches overhanging neighbouring property.

Sycamores (15 and 16) T43 and T42.  Crown reduction is not permitted.  Thin out by 30% regrowth since last pruning, selecting strongest attached stems for retention.
(Reduction works are not permitted because vigorous regrowth may be encouraged post pruning).

Ailanthus (22) T35:  Lowest first branch:  Reduce length back to first major junction.  Reduce remainder of limb.
Lowest second branch:  Remove at source.
Lowest fourth branch:  Reduce in length back to lateral branch junction.

Ash (23) T37:  Reduce back from building to clear by 3m.  Crown thin by 25%.  Crown lift to gutter height; ONLY LATERAL BRANCHES OF DIAMETER LESS THAN 100mm. MAY
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: All the tree work is to be carried out by a competent Tree Surgeon to the recommendation of BS3998: 1989 'Tree Work'. 

 REASON: To protect the health and stability of trees to be retained on the site, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.
